Class TicTacToeGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • TicTacToeGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TicTacToeGame
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    TicTacToeGame creates the instructions text area, the panel of TicTacToeSquares for the game, and the status bar that displays whose turn is next. When a TicTacToeSquare is clicked, the symbol of the player that clicked it is displayed, the game checks for a win or a tie, and the status bar prompts the other player to click a square.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TicTacToeGame

        public TicTacToeGame(int dimensions)
        Constructor, creates a panel with buttons for each cell on the tic tac toe board, a text area that displays instructions, and a text area that tells the players whose turn it is.
        Parameters:
        dimensions, - dimensions is the number of rows and columns that the tic tac toe game will have.

      • TicTacToeGame

        public TicTacToeGame()
        Goes to other constructor with the default board setting of 3.

    • Method Detail

      • displayInstructions

        public javax.swing.JTextArea displayInstructions()
        Creates a text area that displays the game's instructions.
        Returns:
        JTextArea instructions, the text area that displays the instructions.

      • createButtons

        public javax.swing.JPanel createButtons()
        Creates a JPanel for TicTacToeSquares, then creates a TicTacToeSquare for every spot on the tic tac toe board, adds an ActionListener, adds every TicTacToeSquare to the panel, and returns the panel.
        Returns:
        JPanel buttons, a panel with every TicTacToeSquare in it.

      • createTextArea

        public javax.swing.JTextArea createTextArea()
        The text area that displays whose turn it is is created.
        Returns:
        JTextArea playerArea, shows whose turn is next

      • setPlayerTurn

        public void setPlayerTurn()
        The number of the next player is determined.

      • checkTie

        public void checkTie()
        Checks to see if the game had ended in a tie. If so, a JOptionPane is created to inform the players of the tie. NOTE: A tie is detected by all squares being clicked, not when it is impossible for either player to win from any remaining moves.

      • completesMatch

        public boolean completesMatch(int row,
                              int col)
        Checks for a win in the row and column of the clicked square, and in the diagonals if applicable.
        Parameters:
        row, - the row of the clicked piece
        col, - the column of the clicked piece
        Returns:
        true for a win, false for no win

      • completesRow

        public boolean completesRow(int row)
        Checks for a win in the row of the square the player clicked.
        Parameters:
        row, - the row number of the square clicked
        Returns:
        true for a win, false otherwise

      • completesColumn

        public boolean completesColumn(int col)
        Checks for a win in the column of the square the player clicked.
        Parameters:
        col, - the column number of the square clicked
        Returns:
        true for a win, false otherwise

      • completesTopLeftToBottomRight

        public boolean completesTopLeftToBottomRight()
        Checks for a win in the top left to bottom right diagonal.
        Returns:
        true for a win, false otherwise

      • completesTopRightToBottomLeft

        public boolean completesTopRightToBottomLeft()
        Checks for a win in the top right to bottom left diagonal.
        Returns:
        true for a win, false otherwise

      • checkWin

        public void checkWin(int cell)
        Finds the row and column of the TicTacToeSquare clicked and checks if a player won. If a player did win, an option pane informs the players of the winner.
        Parameters:
        cell, - location of the square clicked in the array

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Retrieves the square clicked, matches it with the square in the TicTacToeSquare array, then puts the X or O in the square and checks if a player has won.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e, - used to detect a click of a button
